1    | /**************************************************************************
2    | $Header: ufortify.h Sun 11-19-2000 10:52:32 pm HvA V1.00 $
3    | User options for fortify. Changes to this file require fortify.c to be
4    | recompiled, but nothing else.
5    | ***************************************************************************/
6    | 
7    | #define FORTIFY_STORAGE              /* storage for public functions   */
8    | 
9    | #define FORTIFY_ALIGNMENT        sizeof(double) /* Byte alignment of all memory blocks */
10   | 
11   | #define FORTIFY_BEFORE_SIZE      32  /* Bytes to allocate before block */
12   | #define FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE   0xA3  /* Fill value before block        */
13   |                       
14   | #define FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE       32  /* Bytes to allocate after block  */
15   | #define FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE    0xA5  /* Fill value after block         */
16   | 
17   | #define FORTIFY_FILL_ON_ALLOCATE               /* Nuke out malloc'd memory       */
18   | #define FORTIFY_FILL_ON_ALLOCATE_VALUE   0xA7  /* Value to initialize with       */
19   | 
20   | #define FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE             /* free'd memory is cleared       */
21   | #define FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE 0xA9  /* Value to de-initialize with    */
22   | 
23   | #define FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION             /* Nuke out corrupted memory    */
24   | 
25   | #define FORTIFY_CHECK_ALL_MEMORY_ON_ALLOCATE     /* !! added */
26   | #define FORTIFY_CHECK_ALL_MEMORY_ON_DEALLOCATE   /* !! added */
27   | #define FORTIFY_PARANOID_DEALLOCATE
28   | 
29   | #define FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ZERO_MALLOC  /* !! added */ /* A debug is issued on a malloc(0) */
30   | #define FORTIFY_FAIL_ON_ZERO_MALLOC  /* !! added */ /* A malloc(0) will fail            */
31   | 
32   | #define FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ALLOCATE_FAIL    /* A debug is issued on a failed alloc  */
33   | #define FORTIFY_WARN_ON_FALSE_FAIL       /* See Fortify_SetAllocateFailRate      */
34   | #define FORTIFY_WARN_ON_SIZE_T_OVERFLOW  /* Watch for breaking the 64K limit in  */
35   |                                          /* some braindead architectures...      */
36   | 
37   | #define FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
38   | 
39   | #define FORTIFY_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY_LIMIT 1048576 /* Maximum amount of deallocated bytes to keep */
40   | #define FORTIFY_VERBOSE_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY  /* !! added */
41   | 
42   | #define FORTIFY_STRDUP                   /* if you use non-ANSI strdup() */
43   | 
44   | #ifdef __HIGHC__
45   |   #define FORTIFY_LOCK()   // Fortify_LockLocalData(1) /* to-do!! */
46   |   #define FORTIFY_UNLOCK() // Fortify_LockLocalData(0)
47   | #else
48   |   #define FORTIFY_LOCK()
49   |   #define FORTIFY_UNLOCK()
50   | #endif
51   | 
52   | #define FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE    256
53   | 
54   | #ifdef __cplusplus                /* C++ only options go here */
55   | 
56   | /*  #define FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_NEW     */
57   | /*  #define FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_DELETE  */
58   | 
59   | /*  #define FORTIFY_AUTOMATIC_LOG_FILE */
60   |     #define FORTIFY_LOG_FILENAME            "fortify.log"
61   |     #include <iostream.h>
62   |     #define FORTIFY_FIRST_ERROR_FUNCTION    cout << "\a\a\aFortify Hit Generated!\n"
63   | 
64   | #endif /* __cplusplus */
